TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit LdapDirectoryIdentifier extends System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryIdentifier

Docs.summary: The class creates a directory identifier for one or more LDAP servers.

MemberSignature.Value: public LdapDirectoryIdentifier (string server);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string server) cil managed

Docs.param:
The server ID. A string specifying the server which can be a domain name, LDAP server name or dotted strings representing the IP address of the LDAP server, or . If , it represents the identity of any domain controller in the domain associated with the computer account.
Optionally, this parameter may also include a port number, separated from the ID itself by a colon (:).
Docs.summary: The constructor creates an instance of the class using the specified server.

MemberSignature.Value: public LdapDirectoryIdentifier (string server, int portNumber);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string server, int32 portNumber) cil managed

Docs.param: The server ID. A string specifying the server which can be a domain name, LDAP server name or dotted strings representing the IP address of the LDAP server. Optionally, this parameter may also include a port number, separated from the ID itself by a colon (:).
The port number to use when connecting to the server.
Docs.summary: The constructor creates an instance of the class using the specified server and properties. This constructor creates an identifier that represents a set of LDAP servers.

MemberSignature.Value: public LdapDirectoryIdentifier (string server, bool fullyQualifiedDnsHostName, bool connectionless);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string server, bool fullyQualifiedDnsHostName, bool connectionless) cil managed

Docs.param: The server ID. A string specifying the server which can be a domain name, LDAP server name or dotted strings representing the IP address of the LDAP server. Optionally, this parameter may also include a port number, separated from the ID itself by a colon (:).

if each element in servers is a fully-qualified DNS host name. If , an element can be an IP address, a DNS domain or host name, or . If , it represents the identity of any domain controller in the domain associated with the computer account.
if the connection is UDP or if the connection uses TCP/IP.
Docs.summary: The constructor creates an instance of the class using the specified server and properties. This constructor creates an identifier that represents a set of LDAP servers.
Docs.exception: Thrown if contains only white space.

MemberSignature.Value: public LdapDirectoryIdentifier (string[] servers, bool fullyQualifiedDnsHostName, bool connectionless);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string[] servers, bool fullyQualifiedDnsHostName, bool connectionless) cil managed

Docs.param: The server ID. A string specifying the server which can be a domain name, LDAP server name or dotted strings representing the IP address of the LDAP server. Optionally, this parameter may also include a port number, separated from the ID itself by a colon (:).

if each element in servers is a fully-qualified DNS host name. If , an element can be an IP address, a DNS domain or host name, or null. If null, it represents the identity of any domain controller in the domain associated with the computer account.
if the connection is UDP or if the connection uses TCP/IP.
Docs.summary: The constructor creates an instance of the class using the specified server and properties. This constructor creates an identifier that represents a set of LDAP servers.

The port number to be used when connecting to the server.

if each element in servers is a fully-qualified DNS host name. If , an element can be an IP address, a DNS domain or host name, or null. If null, it represents the identity of any domain controller in the domain associated with the computer account.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Connectionless { get; }
.property instance bool Connectionless

Docs.summary: The property specifies that the connection is User Datagram Protocol (UDP).
Docs.value: This property is if the connection is UDP. This property is if the LDAP connection is over TCP/IP.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool FullyQualifiedDnsHostName { get; }
.property instance bool FullyQualifiedDnsHostName

Docs.summary: The property specifies that a server name is a fully-qualified DNS host name.
Docs.value: This property is if a server name is a fully-qualified DNS host name.

MemberSignature.Value: public int PortNumber { get; }
.property instance int32 PortNumber

Docs.summary: The property contains the portnumber to be used to connect to the server.
Docs.value: Returns an integer representing the port number.

MemberSignature.Value: public string[] Servers { get; }
.property instance string[] Servers
